bug.author: bhairavmehta95
bug.description:
When running: self._planner.get_next_command(measurements.location, measurements.self.end_point.location, self.end_point.orientation) I get an error that says: (with the function that it pulls from) <denchmark-code> File "/path/to/carla/planner/converter.py", line 161, in _check_input_type if len(input_data) > 2: TypeError: object of type 'Vector3D' has no len() </denchmark-code>
Has anyone seen this problem before? I double checked that each of the four arguments I am passing in are all of type: <class 'carla_server_pb2.Vector3D'>, which seems to the types of both the locations and orientations?

comments.comment: We will check it out. Thanks !
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
